Types

Bytes = distinct string
Debby's binary datatype. Use this if your data contains nulls or non-utf8 bytes. Source   Edit   
Db = distinct pointer
Generic database pointer. Source   Edit   
DbError = object of IOError
Debby error. Source   Edit   
Row = seq[string]
Debby Row type .. just a seq of strings. Source   Edit  

Consts

ReservedNames = ["select", "insert", "update", "delete", "from", "where",
                 "join", "inner", "outer", "left", "right", "on", "group", "by",
                 "order", "having", "limit", "offset", "union", "create",
                 "alter", "drop", "set", "null", "not", "distinct", "as", "is",
                 "like", "and", "or", "in", "exists", "any", "all", "between",
                 "asc", "desc", "case", "when", "then", "else", "end", "some",

Do not use these strings in your tables or column names. Source   Edit  

Procs

proc createTable[T: ref object](db: Db; t: typedesc[T])
Creates a table, errors out if it already exists. Source   Edit   
proc dbError(msg: string) {.noreturn, ...raises: [DbError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Raises a DbError with just a message. Does not query the database for error. Source   Edit   
proc delete[T: ref object](db: Db; obj: T)
Deletes the row that corresponds to the object from the data base. Makes sure the obj.id is set. Source   Edit   
proc dropTable[T](db: Db; t: typedesc[T])
Removes tables, errors out if it does not exist. Source   Edit   
proc dropTableIfExists[T](db: Db; t: typedesc[T])
Removes tables if it exists. Source   Edit   
proc filter[T](db: Db; t: typedesc[T]): seq[T]
Filter without a filter clause just returns everything. Source   Edit   
proc get[T, V](db: Db; t: typedesc[T]; id: V): T
Gets the object by id. Source   Edit   
proc hexNibble(ch: char): int {....raises: [DbError], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Encodes a hex char. Source   Edit   
proc innerSelect[T: ref object](db: Db; it: T; where: string;
                                args: varargs[string, `$`]): seq[T]
Used by innerFilter to make the db.select call. Source   Edit   
proc insertInner[T: ref object](db: Db; obj: T; extra = ""): seq[Row]
Inserts the object into the database. Source   Edit   
proc sqlDump[T](v: T): string
SQL dump into string. Source   Edit   
proc sqlDumpHook[T: distinct](v: T): string
SQL dump hook for strings. Source   Edit   
proc sqlDumpHook[T: SomeFloat | SomeInteger](v: T): string
SQL dump hook for numbers. Source   Edit   
proc sqlDumpHook[T: string](v: T): string
SQL dump hook for strings. Source   Edit

SQL parse distinct. Source   Edit

SQL parse distinct. Source   Edit   
proc sqlParseHook[T: enum](data: string; v: var T)
SQL parse hook to convert to any enum. Source   Edit   
proc sqlParseHook[T: SomeFloat](data: string; v: var T)
SQL parse hook to convert to any float. Source   Edit

SQL parse hook to convert to any integer. Source   Edit

SQL parse hook to convert to any integer. Source   Edit

SQL parse hook to convert to a string. Source   Edit   
proc tableName[T](t: typedesc[T]): string
Converts object type name to table name. Source   Edit

Source   Edit   
proc update[T: ref object](db: Db; obj: T)
Updates the row that corresponds to the object in the database. Makes sure the obj.id is set. Source   Edit

Templates

template createIndex[T: ref object](db: Db; t: typedesc[T];
                                    params: varargs[string])
Creates a index, errors out if it already exists. Source   Edit   
template createIndexIfNotExists[T: ref object](db: Db; t: typedesc[T];
    params: varargs[string])
Creates a index if it does not already exists. Source   Edit   
template delete[T: ref object](db: Db; objs: seq[T])
Deletes a seq of objects from the database. Source   Edit   
template filter[T: ref object](db: Db; t: typedesc[T]; expression: untyped): untyped
Filters type's table with a Nim like filter expression. db.filter(Auto, it.year > 1990) db.filter(Auto, it.make == "Ferrari" or it.make == "Lamborghini") db.filter(Auto, it.year >= startYear and it.year < endYear) Source   Edit   
template insert[T: ref object](db: Db; objs: seq[T])
Inserts a seq of objects into the database. Source   Edit   
template update[T: ref object](db: Db; objs: seq[T])
Updates a seq of objects into the database. Source   Edit   
template upsert[T: ref object](db: Db; obj: T)
Either updates or inserts a ref object into the database. Will read the inserted id back. Source   Edit   
template upsert[T: ref object](db: Db; objs: seq[T])
Either updates or inserts a seq of object into the database. Will read the inserted id back for each object. Source   Edit
